heading: Jaipur
overview:
Jaipur is the capital of India’s Rajasthan state. It evokes the royal
        family that once ruled the region and that, in 1727, founded what is now
        called the Old City, or “Pink City” for its trademark building color. At
        the center of its stately street grid (notable in India) stands the
        opulent, colonnaded City Palace complex. With gardens, courtyards and
        museums, part of it is still a royal residence
inclusion3: Entrance fees (Cable and car and Moon Valley)
inclusion4: Box lunch water, banana apple and chocolate

itinerary.day1Heading: Jaipur Day 1: Unveiling the City's Charm
\"bulletPoints: Discover Jaipur's vibrant local markets, offering a variety of handicrafts, jewelry, fabrics, and carpets.
Check into your chosen hotel for a comfortable and pleasant stay.
Enjoy leisure time, taking advantage of the hotel's recreational facilities or simply unwinding.
Immerse yourself in a shopping extravaganza, exploring Jaipur's unique and exquisite offerings.
Conclude the day with a peaceful overnight stay, ready for more adventures in Jaipur.

itinerary.day2Heading: Jaipur Day Tour: Historical Wonders Unveiled
bulletPoints: Explore the majestic Amber Fort, ascending its hilltop location in an open jeep. Built by Raja Man Singh, it boasts Hindu artistic elements, large ramparts, and cobbled paths overlooking the serene Maota Lake.

Dive into Jaipur's rich history with visits to the City Palace, Jantar Mantar Observatory, and Ram Niwas Gardens. Each site offers a unique perspective on the city's cultural and architectural heritage.
Drive past the iconic Hawa Mahal and Jaigarh Fort, witnessing the city's historical and architectural treasures.
Explore Jaipur, founded by King Sawai Jai Singh, and named the Pink City in 1853. The entire walled city is adorned with buildings painted in the same distinctive pink hue made from sand.

Conclude your day with a late evening drive back to the hotel, reflecting on the historical wonders witnessed throughout the day. Enjoy a peaceful overnight stay, ready to uncover more of Jaipur's charm on the following day.

itinerary.day3Heading: Jaipur to Delhi Journey: Homeward Bound
bulletPoints: Jaipur to Delhi Journey: Homeward Bound
Embark on a scenic drive covering a distance of 260 kilometers, approximately 5 hours.
Take in the landscapes along the way as you head back to the bustling capital.
Reflect on the memories and experiences gathered during your time in Jaipur.
Arrive in Delhi, concluding the trip with the satisfaction of exploring the vibrant Pink City.
